title: minor error in "A Quick Guide to Go's Assembler"
body:
In chapter Symbols, 5th paragraph:

Adding an offset to the name refers to that offset from the symbol's address, so a+4(SB) is four bytes past the start of foo.

should read:

Adding an offset to the name refers to that offset from the symbol's address, so foo+4(SB) is four bytes past the start of foo.
